snippet: After a delicate operation to repair her spine, which she injured in a training run, the Olympic ski cross racer Maria Komissarova was in “grave but stable” condition, doctors said.
abstract: Russian ski cross racer Maria Komissarova, who underwent surgery on her spine after crashing during an Olympic training run, is in 'grave but stable' condition and is transferred to hospital in Munich, where she will receive additional treatment.

byline.original: By SARAH LYALL and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Nikolay Khalip and Andrew Roth contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After a delicate operation to repair her spine, which she injured in a training run, the Olympic ski cross racer Maria Komissarova was in “grave but stable” condition, doctors said.

headline.main: Russian Skier Who Broke Her Spine Is Moved to a German Hospital
headline.print_headline: Russian Skier Who Broke Her Spine Is Moved to a German Hospital
